description: Multichain Modular Privacy Framework with a Decentralized Compliance Network

zero_knowledge_proofs.description: Core privacy mechanism using zero-knowledge proofs for shielded transactions

threshold_cryptography.description: Threshold decryption for compliant selective de-anonymization with multiple trusted revokers

multi_party_computation.evidence: Threshold cryptography suggests MPC usage for distributed trust in compliance network

key_features.gas_optimization: 50-55% gas fee reduction via zk-based queued Merkle tree
key_features.sdk: Plug-and-play middleware solution for easy integration

development_status.mainnet_status: In development, roadmap to mainnet published

academic_foundation.title: zkFi: Privacy-Preserving and Regulation Compliant Transactions using Zero Knowledge Proofs
academic_foundation.author: Amit Chaudhary (amit.chaudhary.3@warwick.ac.uk)

gaps_identified: Specific MPC implementation details not fully documented in public sources
Some repository contents may be private/not publicly accessible
Exact version numbers and dependencies require direct repository access
research_notes: Labyrinth (formerly zkFi) is a well-documented privacy protocol with strong academic foundation. The project combines zero-knowledge proofs and threshold cryptography for privacy-preserving DeFi with regulatory compliance. The zkfi-tech GitHub organization hosts the core codebase, with TypeScript/Solidity as primary languages. The protocol is currently in private testnet phase on Optimism and Ethereum testnets.
